text: Sirens possess a weapon more terrible than singing: silence. It's likely someone had ever escaped from their songs, but never from their silence. Indeed, the terrible seducers did not sing when Ulysses passed; perhaps because they thought that the enemy could only hurt him that way, perhaps because Ulysses' face, which only thought of waxes and chains, made them forget every song. The Chinese Wall, 1917
title: Las sirenas y el silencio
author: Franz Kafka
